meanings.definition: To subject to a challenge or trial
meanings.sent1: She felt nervous about gauntleting the obstacle course.
meanings.sent2: The knights were gauntleting the new recruits to test their skills.
meanings.sent3: The friends decided to have a gauntleting contest to see who could eat the most hot dogs.
meanings.sent4: Facing the final boss felt like gauntleting a formidable foe in a video game.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's pop quiz was a gauntleting experience for the students.

meanings.sent1: The soldiers were gauntleting through enemy territory under heavy fire.
meanings.sent2: The athlete was gauntleting towards the finish line with determination.
meanings.sent3: The kids turned the school hallway into a gauntleting race track during recess.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was gauntleting through a crowd of paparazzi on the red carpet.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel was gauntleting across the power lines to reach the other side of the street.

meanings.definition: To offer or accept a challenge
meanings.sent1: He was gauntleting anyone in the room to a game of chess.
meanings.sent2: The company gauntleted their competitors to a sales contest.
meanings.sent3: The siblings gauntleted each other to a race around the block.
meanings.sent4: She gauntleted her fear of heights by climbing the tall tree in the backyard.
meanings.sent5: The daredevil gauntleted the laws of gravity with his risky stunts.
